name: The Town Inside Me
description:
Art and music used here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1PxL88MWtjxt8re3Z3juKEhjZDFSz6j5P77XpZo2FSPE/edit?usp=sharing

Crayon style drawings were done personally.

Made For Brackey's Game Jam 2022.  A mix between a visual novel and a tile-based dungeon crawl, each trying to hit the theme somewhere between wholesome and creepy.  It's split between seven days and nights.  Days are a brief story snippet about someone learning to reconnect with their friends and family.  Not alone in the wholesome sense.

Nights are a repeated nightmare sequence where you have to dungeon delve towards the end of the game.  Not alone in the 'there are monsters in the dark' sense.  'Dying' just means you wake up but you only have the seven days.  

There should be enough to get a feel for the vibe and direction I wanted.

While a lot of the systems for cutscenes, enemy variations an upgrades are in place...I uh...wound up severely underestimating how long it would take to actually *write* those cutscenes, get the art for the sprites during the 'day scenes' and actually playtest stats and placement of enemies.  So a lot is unfortunately bare bones though I may revisit and update it after the jam ends.
